title: Riot, it was banter!
body:
So we just played a 5 man game against another 5 man, which had one played we all knew in real life: King Man Ultra. We engaged in some "friendly" banter (was kinda over the top tbh) and some of us might have said offensive words. We jokingly reported him after the game so he gets a chat restriction, because we are friends like that lol. What surprised us after the game was that he actually got permabanned on his account. Now this wasn't the 10th time he had been suspended, it was actually the first time since season 4 where he got suspended for leaving too many games. 

We feel really bad right now because he had played a ton of games on that account, and really does not deserve the ban since it was just friends talking shit to each other, which happens in all games. You can contact every single member of both teams to make sure that we knew him, which you guys probably have all the usernames in the game logs. Here's the link: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2419734871/28398878?tab=overview

Thank you for your help

> Riot, it was banter!

It was ~~locker room talk~~ hate speech. We have a zero tolerance policy towards hate speech. 

> We feel really bad right now

Each player is responsible for their own behavior. You are not responsible for this player's punishment.

Tell you what ...

If every single person in this game who reported posts here in the next 3 days, rescinding their report, I'll see what I can do about getting it reduced to a 14 day ban.

But, be aware that hate speech is something we take very seriously. The only reason I am giving this offer is because they weren't reported by their teammates (5-man premade), they have no prior penalty history, and the enemy (5-man premade) team is posting here on their behalf.

This is so gracious and merciful that I'm a little bit in awe, tbh.

I have never seen someone complaining that they got insta-permabanned for those things, which leads me to believe that the rules apply selectively.

> As an irrelevant sidenote: What does heterophobic language look ilke?

Same as so-called "homophobic language".

Absence of evidence is not evidence of absence.

The overwhelming majority of hatespeech that I personally see in games is homophobic, so I'm going to expect at least a proportionate majority of permabans for hatespeech being issued for homophobia.

Why I say "at least"? Because the frequency of an offense also makes it easier to detect and process that kind of offense, which means that even if the same policy is applied to all kinds of hatespeech, it is easier to apply to the more common cases.

If 90% of all burglaries consistently happened to the exact same shop, then said shop would probably be under constant observation of the police, meaning people that **still** break into that shop would be far more likely to be caught than everybody else. That doesn't imply unfair treatement, let alone that other burglaries aren't going to be punished.

I have actually heard people say:

"White trash piece of shit cis scum" unironically, but i belive saying that ingame will lead to an easy permaban.

1: They do truly care about their player base. Despite what went down, Tantram here is still willing to give a little leeway due to the situation. In any other situation, he wouldn't budge an inch (which is a good thing)

2: Riot actually does look at those reports. People complain about the Tribunal being gone for so long, but, in a sense, it still exists due to the report system. It's just a a different system that Riot may have a more control over than what they had over the Tribunal.

Now, you might say "Well, this is Behavior and Moderation, which is a completely different department than, say, Gameplay", which is true. But every department does hold the overall core values of the company to heart. You may think Riot doesn't care, and is only in it for the BIG BUCK$, but once you look at a situation like this......it simply isn't true.
